title: Digital-Payments Growth Has a Ways to Run Yet
sub_head: The pandemic caused some changes in how consumers pay, but cash and in-person shopping haven’t been pushed aside completely
body:
Cash hasn’t gone away yet. That is actually good news for many payments stocks.
One big concern about payment companies has been that the surge in digital transactions and online purchases during the Covid-19 pandemic was a one-time shift in habits that pulled ahead years of growth, leaving much less runway for these stocks. But Visa Chief Financial Officer Vasant Prabhu, speaking at a Bernstein conference late last week, said that based on the company’s best calculations, growth in the conversion of cash to digital through the pandemic was accelerated by maybe only one year.
